alert.note: Alert for Clark; Cowlitz; Pacific; Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 6:51PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: .A warm front will be slowly moving northward across western Oregon tonight into Sunday. Rain, heavy at times, is expected tonight into Sunday morning. Cold front will push onshore by early Sunday afternoon, with rain easing. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall and poor drainage is expected. * WHERE...Much of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon, excluding the high Cascades and the Hood River Valley. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying, such as railroad crossings and underpasses, as well as other areas with poor drainage. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is likely tonight into Sunday, especially where storm drains may be clogged with leave debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM PST, Rain will increase tonight, becoming heavy at times overnight into Sunday morning. Rain will decrease towards midday Sunday. - New rainfall 1 to 3 inches are expect across the interior lowlands, with the heaviest to south of Portland. Meanwhile, rainfall of 2 to 5 inches are expected across the coastal mountains and along the coast as well as the Cascades foothills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
